notesStmt.note: A former owner's note, folio 1v: שלי [... ]. קניתיו אלינקנטו בדמים יקרים ה' יזכני להגות בו אני וזרעי וזרע זרעי עם שאר ספרי הקדש ברוב טוב וחיים טובים וברכה ושלו' מעתה ועד עולם. Owner's name has been cut out after the word שלי.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The commentary of Naḥmanides (Moshe ben Nahman aka ha-Ramban) on the Pentateuch.

collation.p: 19 quires: i-xvi10 (folios 1-160), xvii12 (folios 161-172), xviii10 (folios 173-182), xix12 (folios 183-192). No catchwords. Quire numbers are in the lower left corner of the first folios.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Italian-Ashkenazi semi-cursive script, unpunctuated. The letter 'alef' is in a Sefardi style throughout. Arieh Ḥalfan ben Eli῾ezer Ḥalfan: inscribed with his name in the colophon, together with Pinḥas Yaḳar ben Yitsḥaḳ Yaḳar: dated Tamuz 5251, folio 191r.

decoDesc.decoNote: 2vInitial word included into a medallion decorated with foliate motifs in brown ink.

binding.p: Pre-1600. Brown leather with clasps and metalic corners, tooled in gold. Spine title: 'R. Mosis ben Nachman Commentarius in Pentateuchum. Hebraice. Mus. Brit. Jure. Empt. 18,731.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Major Macdonald's collection ([192v]). Purchased at Lewis's sale room, 18 July 1851 (192v]).
